function.name: generate_keywords
function.description: Use this function to generate keywords that corresponds to model hamiltonian. This function is also explaining the physics of parameters of constructed hamiltonian.

save_integrals.description: A boolean value that determines whether to save the integrals

integral_format.description: The output format of the integrals.

bc.description: The boundary conditions of the integrals. Boundary conditions are periodic for ring-like systems and open for chain-like systems.

hamiltonian.description: The type of hamiltonian to generate. Supported hamiltonians are Richardson-Gaudin (RG), Hubbard, Heisenberg, Huckel, Pariser-Parr-Pople (PPP), Ising.

basis.description: Spatial or spin-orbital basis set to use.

norb.description: Number of spatial orbitals. Should equal to the number of electrons if there is no information about the number of spatial orbitals.

nelec.description: Number of electrons. Should equal to the number of spatial orbitals if there is no information about the number of electrons.

alpha.description: Energy of the orbital. Don't use for spin-based hamiltonians.

beta.description: Energy of interaction between adjacent orbitals. Also called hopping parameter. Sometimes is denoted as t. Don't use for spin-based hamiltonians.

u_onsite.description: Coulomb interaction between electrons on the same site. Don't use for spin-based hamiltonians.

charges.description: Charge at each site of the system.

mu.description: Zeemam term, also called strenght of the magnetic field.

J_eq.description: Coupling energy along x,y axes between spins. If hamiltonian is Richardson-Gauding, use just this parameter. For XXX model, this parameter is equal to J_ax.

J_ax.description: Coupling energy along z axis between spins. If hamiltonian is Ising, use just this parameter. For XXX model, this parameter is equal to J_eq.

outdir.description: The directory to save the integrals.

prefix.description: The prefix of the integrals file.

explanation.description: Explantion of the generated hamiltoninan. Explain the physical meaning of the provided parameters.

connectivity.description: Connectivity of the system. Should be a list of lists which have to be a adjacency matrix. For example, for a chain-like system with 4 sites, connectivity=[[0, 1],[1, 2],[2, 3]]. Should be returned if connectivity is mentioned.

moltype.description: The geometry of the molecule. Supported types are 1d and 2d.

Lx.description: The linear size of the x direction for 2d moltype of size Lx by Ly. Required for 2d moltype.

Ly.description: The linear size of the y direction for 2d moltype of size Lx by Ly. Required for 2d moltype.
